result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan P. Lohrentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Credit for 1 day, if probation is revoked.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan P. Lohrentz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
A.D.A. Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Chalchoff.
Amended information filed by the state. The sole count in the information is amended to failure to obey traffic officer / signal.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to the amended information. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty of the amended charge.
The Court orders that sentence be withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of one year. 
Conditions:  pay all costs and fees, undergo AODA and any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent and abide by all treatment recommendations, and complete 25 hours of community service.
1 day credit if revoked.
Appeal rights were provided.
Phone call from Attorney Chalchoff.  Remove 1/21/16 PLEAS.  He will call Br. 1 on 1/21/16 to reschedule 30 days out.  dcb.
